### Description
Upon publishing a release, the [release workflow](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/.github/workflows/release.yml)  should publish updated `latest` tags for the corresponding version.  For some reason this task is failing since [23.4.1](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/actions/runs/5137011125/jobs/9245855066)

This might be dockerhub permissions or problems with self-hosted runners.


### Acceptance Criteria
* triggering the release workflow should work as anticipated

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. publish a release

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
hyperledger/besu:latest tag (among others) get updated to a manifest image of the latest amd64 and arm64 images

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
manifestDockerRelease task fails with an error:
  `refusing to amend an existing manifest list with no --amend flag`

**Frequency:** [What percentage of the time does it occur?]
100%

[Last successful run](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/actions/runs/4884808573) (for 23.4.0) logs look like this:
```

Created manifest list docker.io/***/besu:latest
sha256:95dc6f7[29](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/actions/runs/4884808573/jobs/8718054965#step:7:30)5c3cd9ba73a1b87d79f19e1ee451c6079c[35](https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/actions/runs/4884808573/jobs/8718054965#step:7:36)e88cb90d1dcea1490fe
```

For 23.4.1, despite the logs, it appeared to publish all latest-<variant> tags except the final `latest`.
Here you can see the difference between the manually updated `lastest` (@garyschulte ran the gradle task locally) versus all the others that succeeded when using the GHA...
